bibl.title: Letter from Henry M. Hurd to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 14, 1904

div1.p: Hurd discusses the support of Johns Hopkins Hospital by Rockefeller. The Lazear memorial tablet is finished and the balance of the funds will go to Mabel Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Henry M. Hurd to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 14, 1904
div1.p:
It is very kind
of you to remember our satisfaction
in securing through Mr. Rockefeller
the means of continuing the
work of the Hospital both as a
charitable institution and as an
adjunct to a large medical
school. Unless this generous
gift had been made the coming
two years would have brought
great anxieties and a serious
cutting down of necessary
work. We are very grateful
to the many friends who
been interested in our misfortunes
and who have shown so much
pleasure in our bettered prospects.

You may be interested
to learn that Dr. Paton has at
last arranged for the memorial
tablet for your son's memory
and has formed the plan
to send the balance of the
fund to Mrs. Lazear to
be used for her children.
The delay has been due
to causes beyond his control.

The inscription for the tablet
has been prepared by
President Eliot of Havana
who has been warmly
interested in the memorial
tablet from the first.
With many thanks for your letter
